meanings.definition: To grant or pay a pension to (someone)
meanings.sent1: The company is pensioning its long-serving employees.
meanings.sent2: After many years of service, the government is pensioning the retired workers.
meanings.sent3: The boss joked that he would start pensioning everyone who arrived late to work.
meanings.sent4: She felt like the company was pensioning her off like an old piece of machinery.
meanings.sent5: The act of pensioning symbolizes gratitude for years of hard work.

meanings.definition: To retire or dismiss (someone) with a pension
meanings.sent1: The organization is pensioning off its senior executives.
meanings.sent2: He was pensioning his loyal secretary after decades of service.
meanings.sent3: The idea of pensioning off the troublesome employee brought relief to the team.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was being pensioned off to enjoy her golden years.
meanings.sent5: Pensioning off employees is a way to honor their dedication to the company.
